Vocabularies.Definition: in the center of  在…中心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Apartments in the heart of the city are too expensive.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 厄瓜多尔人            a. 厄瓜多尔的
a. not changed or damaged yet 未改变的，未受破坏的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Local people told us that this was the only unspoiled forest in this country.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a feeling of respect and liking for sb./sth. 钦佩，羡慕
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We have a great admiration for the people's heroes.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. far away from cities and difficult to reach 偏僻的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Their destination this time is a quiet, out-of-the-way resort.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    树桩
n.   the slope of a bank especially of a stream （尤指溪流的）岸坡
n.    盖屋顶的材料；茅草屋顶
n.   the place where a river begins 源头 e.g.  Do you know where is the headwaters of the Yangtze River?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Do you know where is the headwaters of the Yangtze River?

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   欧夜鹰
vi.   be or become silent 安静下来，变得安静
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Having cried for half an hour, the little boy hushed.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  in an idle manner 空闲地，懒惰地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Since we've got a long holiday we spend a lot of time watching TV, drinking, shopping, or just stay at home idly.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  鸟蛛，狼蛛
n.  蛾，蛀虫
n.    电灯泡；球状物
n.   萤火虫
vt.  scatter (drops of liquid, etc.) on a surface 溅，洒
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Hot grease spattered in all directions.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. shine light on 照亮，照明
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The sky was illumined by flashes from the volcano.

Vocabularies.Definition: at one time...at another time... 忽而…忽而…
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The junior officer who came into the room looked nervous; his eyes swiveled quickly, now this way, now that, as if he were scanning the room for danger.

Vocabularies.Definition: in (all)silence with (complete) absence of sound or noise （完全）不出声地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The kids were listening to the music in the classroom, in complete silence.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  catch in or as in a net, trap; mix together or intertwine in a confused mass 使卷入，使陷入；使缠结，使混乱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I have the sort of hair that tangles easily.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   泡沫，水沫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We see foam on water with a lot of soap in it.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   extend over a surface 蔓延，伸展
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Roses trailing over the walls made her garden so beautiful.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  form or bend into a loop 使成环状
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She looped the scarf round her neck and went out into the cold night air.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  wind; twist 蜿蜒；缠绕，交织
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The fence post was twined by vines.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  reduce or stop the sound of 减弱（或停止）…的声音
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  At the sight of their teacher walking into the classroom, they muted their voices.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  fade away, disappear 消散，消失
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The characteristics of gases vary widely. Some gases are transparent, some dissolve in water, and some have a strong smell.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.   向下游；在下游 e.g.  We drifted downstream.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We drifted downstream. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. untie, release 解开，放开 e.g.  The hunter loosed the arrow without warning.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The hunter loosed the arrow without warning. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a length of woven hair, rope, etc. 辫子；辫状编织物
vi.  leave a ship or airplane after a voyage  上岸，登陆 e.g.  I looked towards the plane. Six passenger had already disembarked.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I looked towards the plane. Six passenger had already disembarked. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. sit or fall down heavily 重重地坐下（或倒下） e.g.  Kennedy had been hit and slumped to the floor of the automobile.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Kennedy had been hit and slumped to the floor of the automobile. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   西班牙语
n.   盖丘亚族（南美印第安人分支）语；盖丘亚族人
n.  （脚）趾

Vocabularies.Word: be dying to do sth. /for sth.
Vocabularies.Definition: desire (to do) sth. eagerly 非常想做某事（或得到某物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She was dying to tell them the good news that she had won first prize in the speech contest.

Vocabularies.Definition: catch hold of, find or get (sth.)  抓到，得到
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I wish I could get my hands on a copy of Harry Potter.

Vocabularies.Definition: separate into its different parts 拆开，分开
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   When I was young, my parents never blamed me for taking my toys apart.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  牛仔裤
n.  排球
a.    extraordinary; very attractive or impressive 与众不同的；引人入胜的，壮观的 e.g.  The British Museum, one of the most spectacular museums in the world, is renowned for its extensive and diverse collection.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The British Museum, one of the most spectacular museums in the world, is renowned for its extensive and diverse collection. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the outer edge or limit of sth. 边缘，边界 e.g.  Near the outer fringes of the solar system lies dark blue Neptune, a gas giant that probably has no true surface.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Near the outer fringes of the solar system lies dark blue Neptune, a gas giant that probably has no true surface. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a space sunk into something 洞穴 e.g.  The explorer fell into a muddy hollow while walking in the forest.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The explorer fell into a muddy hollow while walking in the forest. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: with specifics 详细地 e.g.  The police asked the victim of the robbery to describe what happened to him in detail.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The police asked the victim of the robbery to describe what happened to him in detail. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a stream that flows into a larger stream or other body of water 支流
n., a.   河边（的），河畔（的） e.g.   His father used to live in the riverside cottage in Wales.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His father used to live in the riverside cottage in Wales. e.g.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.     番石榴
n.  not clear enough to allow light through 不透光的，不透明的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Milk is often stored in opaque containers to prevent vitamins from being destroyed by light.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  make (sth.) dirty；spread (a thick liquid, etc.) over a surface 弄脏；涂抹
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Don't smear the glasses; I've just polished them.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   鹦鹉
n.   a group of certain animals （动物）群              in flocks  a.   in groups 成群地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Penguins are gregarious birds and are found in flocks even at sea.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  move suddenly and rapidly 迅疾地飞（奔）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boy darted behind the sofa as his father stormed into the living room.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   大水蟒
vt.   believe, consider 认为，称为
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She is widely reputed to be 25 years younger than her husband.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   大蟒蛇
n.    鳄鱼
vt.  expose, uncover 使露出，裸露
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The dog bared its teeth.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a long narrow region of land or body of water; a long narrow piece 狭长的地域(或水域)；条，带
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  About 30 million people live along the Californian coastal strip.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   沙洲
ad.  recently, newly 刚才，新近地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  This is Richard, who joined our team freshly.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  用桨划（船）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Canoes can be paddled by one or more persons.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (also dugout canoe)   独木舟
n.   吊床
n.   one that explores, especially one that explores a geographic area 探险家，考察者
no longer in view 在视野以外，看不见
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The woman didn't go into the house until her daughter drove away and slowly faded out of sight.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    蝴蝶
a.   有条纹的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She looked slim in her green and white striped shirt.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a long strip 长列
n.   蚂蚁
a.   shaped like a triangle 三角形的            triangle    n.   a flat, three-sided geometric figure 三角形
n.  a number of warships under one command 舰队
n.  a small open boat that one sails or rows 小帆船，划子
vi.   move in an unbalanced way 摇晃，摇摆
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The child's voice wobbled with emotion.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  用大砍刀砍削而成的
n.   a pole with a flat blade pulled by hand to row a boat 桨
n.   (usu. pl) a shallow place or area in a body of water 浅水域，浅滩
n.   竹（竿）
vt. pierce with a sharp stake or point 刺穿，钉住
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The boy fell out of the window and was impaled on the fence.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  cut, chop 砍，斩
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He had his arm lopped off by an electric saw.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   装饰，装饰品 e.g.  When will they finish the decoration of the bathroom?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  When will they finish the decoration of the bathroom?

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    苍鹭
v. walk slowly and heavily on（在…上）缓慢而沉重地行走
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Don't bother him right now. He's plodding through a mountain of paperwork.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   翠鸟
n.  布谷鸟，杜鹃
vi.    move quickly and noisily; (cause to) make continuous loud noises by hitting hard objects against each other 喧闹地移动；（使）咔嗒咔嗒地响
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She dropped the bucket and it went clattering down the stairs.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  bustle about; give too much attention to small and unimportant matters 忙乱；大惊小怪
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  As soon as they saw the manager the waiters began fussing around the tables.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    船头
vt.   shoot; hit with something flat 弹射；拍击
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Catherine responded to the man's attempt by slapping him.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   弹弓
n.    皮带
too far away to be reached, seen or heard 在射程外的，够不到的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We thought that we were out of range of their rifles until the bullets started kicking up the dust in front of us.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  热带雨林
a.   a covering that can be pulled down over a window 窗帘
n.    海岸线
vi. move wildly or violently 猛烈摆动，翻腾
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The swimmers were thrashing about in the water.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.    巨滑舌鱼（南美食用大型淡水鱼）
n. 水虎鱼（南美产的一种小鱼）
n.  鳗，鳝鱼
vt.  hang or swing loosely 摆动；悬垂
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A kite is dangling from a telephone wire.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  an untidy pile of something 一堆，大量
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He left his books in a heap on the floor.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   愁苦的；渴求的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a wistful expression

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   修女，尼姑
a.  too bright to be seen easily 耀眼的          dazzle   vt.   blind with bright light  使眼花，使目眩
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His second film has been a dazzling success.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  move quickly and silently with ease; fly through the air without power 轻快无声地走；滑翔
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  At the sight of me she glided across the dance floor to greet me.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  藤条
a.  (of sounds) very high in pitch 音调高的，尖声的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a high-pitched debate

Vocabularies.Definition: pron.   （古）（thou的宾格）= you
vi.   move in a crowd  成群地移动，蜂拥
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A dark cloud of bees came swarming out of the hive.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.   (of a person) jump on one foot; (of a bird or other animals) jump with two or all feet at once（人）单足跳，跳跃；（鸟和其他动物）齐足跳
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The birds hopped about and pecked the earth briskly, looking for seeds and insects.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 僧侣穿戴的头巾（或带头巾的长袍）
n.  屋顶

Napo
Amazon
Orion
Pompeya
Ecuador
